ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.2_0: the nuns from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.3_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.4_0: “How can nuns defecate, urinate, and spit in water? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.5_0: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.6_0: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.7_0: “How can the nuns from the group of six defecate, urinate, and spit in water?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.9_0: They in turn told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.10_0: Then the Buddha went up to the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.12_0: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.15_0: “... How can the nuns from the group of six do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.17_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.18.1_0: ‘“I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.19_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.1_0: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, sick nuns did not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.2_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.3_0: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to defecate, urinate, and spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.4_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.5.1_0: ‘“When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.6_0: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.7_0: If, out of disrespect, a nun who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits in water, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.8.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.10_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.13_0: if she does it on dry ground, but it then spreads to water;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.17_0: if he is overwhelmed by pain;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.18_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.19_0: The training rule on the fifteenth day, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.20_0: The seventh sub-chapter on shoes is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.21_0: “Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.22_0: In regard to this I ask you,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.28_0: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.29_0: The chapter on training rules is finished.
